body:
### Problem

When viewing diff files in a terminal buffer, I usually open the buffer, view the diff, and immediately close the buffer. Right now I'm relying completely on the terminal for colors but it'd be great if I could just tell that buffer "Please syntax highlight this buffer as though it was a diff file". But that doesn't seem to be possible yet.

### Steps to reproduce

<details>
<summary>See reproduction.lua file</summary>

```lua
-- DO NOT change the paths and don't remove the colorscheme
local root = vim.fn.fnamemodify("./.repro", ":p")

-- set stdpaths to use .repro
for _, name in ipairs({ "config", "data", "state", "cache" }) do
  vim.env[("XDG_%s_HOME"):format(name:upper())] = root .. "/" .. name
end

-- bootstrap lazy
local lazypath = root .. "/plugins/lazy.nvim"
if not vim.loop.fs_stat(lazypath) then
  vim.fn.system({ "git", "clone", "--filter=blob:none", "https://github.com/folke/lazy.nvim.git", lazypath, })
end
vim.opt.runtimepath:prepend(lazypath)

-- install plugins
local plugins = {
    {
        "nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter",
        build = ":TSUpdate",
        config = function()
            require("nvim-treesitter.configs").setup {
                ensure_installed = { "diff" },
                highlight = {
                    enable = true,
                },
            }
        end
    },
}
require("lazy").setup(plugins, {
  root = root .. "/plugins",
})

vim.api.nvim_create_user_command(
    "OpenDiff",
    "terminal cat /tmp/diff.diff",
    { nargs = 0 }
)

vim.api.nvim_create_user_command(
    'OpenDiff2',
    'execute "terminal cat /tmp/diff.diff" | lua vim.treesitter.start(0, "diff")',
    { nargs = 0 }
)

vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd(
    "TermOpen",
    { callback = function() vim.treesitter.start(0, "diff") end }
)


```
</details>

Make a diff file for `/tmp/diff.diff`

```sh
echo -e "foo\nbar" > /tmp/a
echo -e "foot\ntar\nthing" > /tmp/b
diff -u /tmp/a /tmp/b > /tmp/diff.diff
```

Open nvim with `nvim -u reproduction.lua` and call `:OpenDiff` or `:OpenDiff2`, neither will have diff highlighting. However if you're in the normal mode in the terminal buffer and manually type `:lua vim.treesitter.start(0, "diff")` then it works

### Expected behavior

Setting the terminal buffer with the "diff" parser should apply that tree-sitter parser to the buffer. Either as a part of `TermOpen` or as a follow-up command such as `execute "terminal cat /tmp/diff.diff" | lua vim.treesitter.start(0, "diff")`

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.10.0-dev-2465+ga7788c2e2

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

n/a

### Operating system/version

CentOS Linux 7 (Core)

### Terminal name/version

gnome-terminal - # GNOME Terminal 3.28.2 using VTE 0.52.4 +GNUTLS

### $TERM environment variable

screen-256color

### Installation

Compiled from source
title: Cannot set treesitter parser for terminal buffer on `TermOpen`
